contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox rugby biography | image = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1938|7|12}} | birth_place = [[Arapuni]] | height = {{convert|1.91|m|ftin|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|99|kg|lbs|abbr=on}} | ru_position = Lock, Loose Forward |ru_currentposition = Retired |ru_amateuryears = 1957â€“66 |ru_amateurclubs = [[King Country Rugby Football Union|King Country]] |ru_amupdate = | ru_nationalyears = 1961-1966 | ru_nationalteam = {{ru|New Zealand}} | ru_nationalcaps = 30 | ru_nationalpoints =(12) }} '''Stanley Thomas Meads''' (born 12 July 1938 in Arapuni, [[New Zealand]]) was a [[rugby union]] footballer and brother of [[Colin Meads]], considered by some to be one of the greatest rugby footballers of all time. He played as a [[Rugby union positions#4._.26_5._Lock|lock]], [[Rugby_union_positions#8._Number_Eight|No 8]] and [[Rugby_union_positions#6._Blindside_flanker_.26_7._Openside_flanker|flanker]], and scored four tries for New Zealand in 30 games (15 tests). He played for [[King Country Rugby Football Union|King Country]] between 1957 and 1966, when he abruptly announced his retirement to concentrate on his sheep farm near [[Te Kuiti]]. ==External links== *{{All Blacks|id=602|name=Stan Meads}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Meads, Stan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = New Zealand rugby union player | DATE OF BIRTH = 12 July 1938 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Arapuni]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Meads, Stan}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:New Zealand international rugby union players]] [[Category:New Zealand rugby union players]] [[Category:Living people]] {{NewZealand-rugbyunion-bio-stub}}
